title: Design Thinking for Marginalized Communities
summary: Bilal facilitates a global design thinking workshop for marginalized communities, emphasizing storytelling, emotional connection, and personal experience as foundations for social impact work.

key_decisions.decision: Structure workshop around storytelling and feelings on Day 1 before moving to action on Day 2
key_decisions.rationale: Believes emotional foundation and story understanding are prerequisites for sustainable problem-solving
key_decisions.evidence: Repeatedly emphasized 'he who has a strong why can overcome any how'
key_decisions.outcome_tracking: Day 2 scheduled to operationalize day 1 learnings

key_decisions.decision: Create inclusive space for everyone to share stories and nicknames
key_decisions.rationale: Believed knowing each other deeply ('seeing each other's truths') creates conditions for genuine collaboration
key_decisions.evidence: Spent significant time on nicknames, personal history, family connections
key_decisions.outcome_tracking: Participants reported feeling connected and seeing potential collaborations

key_decisions.rationale: Believed narrow solutions mask bigger problems; wanted to help participants pivot
key_decisions.evidence: Asked Nilam about solar lamps vs job creation focus
key_decisions.outcome_tracking: Normalized pivoting conversation; showed it's part of design process

key_decisions.decision: Emphasize listening and understanding over expert problem-solving
key_decisions.rationale: Believed 'letting go of what you know so you can listen enough' is prerequisite
key_decisions.evidence: First half of workshop dedicated to listening; he entered breakout rooms to listen

key_decisions.decision: Bring full self (cultural identity, personal history) to professional facilitation
key_decisions.rationale: Modeled that authenticity and humanity are professional assets, not separate
key_decisions.evidence: Shared Arab family traditions, explained his nickname 'Bulbul', used 'Inshallah'
key_decisions.outcome_tracking: Created permission for others to bring whole selves

key_decisions.rationale: Believed intention without action doesn't reach people; operationalization is part of love
key_decisions.evidence: Said 'you can care about a problem but there needs to be output'
key_decisions.outcome_tracking: Moved workshop toward day 2 action planning

meta_observations.use_of_ai_in_conversation: Request-based: asked AI to extract quotes from transcript, AI provided curated list
meta_observations.key_insight: Bilal's approach to design thinking is deeply relational and emotionally grounded, starting with story and feeling before moving to action
meta_observations.next_steps_inferred: Day 2 workshop to operationalize day 1 learnings; participants expected to move from storytelling to action planning
